subject: Sleep
title: ADHD and Delayed Sleep
description: A micro-lesson that makes ADHD and Delayed Sleep usable.

hook.text: Up to 75 percent of adults with ADHD can't fall asleep before midnight, no matter how early they get into bed.

buildup.text: ADHD brains show a delayed circadian rhythm, with melatonin onset shifted one to two hours later than average.

discovery.text: The same dopamine deficiency that causes ADHD symptoms also affects the SCN's ability to entrain to light cues.

twist.text: Many ADHD patients are misdiagnosed with insomnia or labeled as lazy night owls when the issue is neurological.

climax.text: Low-dose melatonin taken early in the evening can advance the clock and improve sleep onset in ADHD patients.

punchline.text: ADHD doesn't just steal your focus. It steals your bedtime.

quiz.question: Why do people with ADHD often have delayed sleep onset?
options: ADHD involves a delayed circadian rhythm linked to dopamine deficiency
They choose to stay up late
